alert.note: Alert for Yell (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 20 at 9:32PM CDT until further notice by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Arkansas... Petit Jean River At Danville affecting Yell County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Petit Jean River At Danville. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Minor flooding begins, agricultural lands along the river begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 18.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.7 feet early Thursday afternoon. - Action stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecast 7 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Crest Time Date Petit Jean River Danville 20.0 17.3 Wed 1 PM 19.6 18.9 17.8 19.7 1 PM 4/21 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
